intro: Tephrosia villosa subsp. ehrenbergiana, commonly known as the hairy tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale yellow. Its botanical features include hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
